meta.title: COVID19 - SCHOOL CLOSURE INFORMATION - Tracy Unified School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: COVID19 - SCHOOL CLOSURE INFORMATION - Tracy Unified School District

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: COVID19 - SCHOOL CLOSURE INFORMATION, Tracy Unified School District
COVID19 - SCHOOL CLOSURE INFORMATION - Tracy Unified School District
COVID19 - SCHOOL CLOSURE INFORMATION - Tracy Unified School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasThreeColumnTopLayout fsSection332 fsHasTheme2

li.a: Access to Optional Educational Opportunities During School Closure
George & Evelyn Stein Continuation High School
George & Evelyn Stein Continuation High School
Access to Optional Educational Opportunities During School Closure

span.style: font-size: 17px; letter-spacing: 1.13px; text-transform: uppercase; background-color: rgb(145, 52, 60);

p.strong: TUSD WILL CLOSE ALL SCHOOLS BEGINNING MONDAY, MARCH 16, 2020 THROUGH MAY 22, 2020.

PRESCHOOL ENROLLMENT INFO:
Information in English & Spanish
If you have questions regarding preschool please email below:
p.br:
Tasha Mathews: tmathews@tusd.net
Marie Martinez: mmartinez@tusd.net

div.p:
Please review the FAQs for information.
We will update this frequently.

p.strong: Meals are also available for students in the Young Adult Program
Tracy Unified School District is doing the following to stay current with this health issue:

ul.li: Extra cleaning of all of our school sites
All of our decisions are guided by the San Joaquin County Office of Education and San Joaquin County Public Health Department.
Communicating by email, websites, Facebook, text and phone messages.

p.b: Please read this MESSAGE from Tracy Adult School regarding Credit Recovery Students.

div.p: If you have further questions regarding your student, please contact our Student Services Department at 209.830.3280.

Tracy Unified School District recognizes that school closures due to COVID-19 are challenging times for our students and families. The California Department of Education requires districts to provide Distance Learning Education to our students during school closure to include assigned work. As stated by California Department of Education, for the duration of school closure due to COVID-19, “students shall be held harmless”. This means Distance Learning assignments during school closure may only be used to help a student’s grade.

The District is currently working on a Distance Learning Grading Plan for grades PreK-12 for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, with the end result that all teachers assign final grades for all students at the conclusion of the school year. More information will be provided by the District in the near future regarding the grading plan.

p.b: If your student has an IEP, we encourage you to reach out to your student's case manager for further information or questions concerning your student.

div.p: Here are links to various PE activities:

p.strong:
For more Ideas for APE, please visit the
Special Education Page

img.alt: Pictures showing how to stop germs
SPANISH - HOW TO NOT SPREAD GERMS AND PICTURES
FACTS ABOUT THE VIRUS WITH PICTURES

video.div: Your web browser does not support the <video> tag.

p.b: Teacher emails and office hours starting April 20th can be found on the Distance Learning pages:

div.p: To find the Distance Learning Page for your student's school, click on the link below:

p.strong: Each school website also has a direct link from their homepage.
For more information, please visit the following links:

a.strong: San Joaquin County Public Health Services

span.strong: are you planning to travel during spring break?

p.strong: SPRING BREAK WILL REMAIN AS PLANNED.

div.p: With spring break and possible family vacations approaching, you should also be aware that the disease has spread to other countries and the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) has issued new travel warnings with increased concern for South Korea, Japan, and Italy. Travel warnings from mainland China have have not changed. Additional travel warnings can be found here:

span.strong: Please visit the CDC's Travel FAQs Page
